definition: Topographic position index (TPI), defined as the difference between the elevation of the focal cell and Mean elevation of the surrounding cells within a defined “neighborhood
provider: Amatulli, G., Domisch, S., Tuanmu, M.-N., Parmentier, B., Ranipeta, A., Malczyk, J., and Jetz, W. (2018) A suite of global, cross-scale topographic variables for environmental and biodiversity modeling. Scientific Data volume 5, Article number: 180040. DOI: doi:10.1038/sdata.2018.40
citation: Amatulli, G., Domisch, S., Tuanmu, M.-N., Parmentier, B., Ranipeta, A., Malczyk, J., and Jetz, W. (2018) A suite of global, cross-scale topographic variables for environmental and biodiversity modeling. Scientific Data volume 5, Article number: 180040. DOI: doi:10.1038/sdata.2018.40
column12: mTPI - derived from elevation layer in Amatulli but is custom = multi-scale topographic position value. Values represent the absolute maximum difference between a pixel and the surrounding area at 5 radii (r=1.5km-115.5km) specifically - 1.5km, 2.5, 5.5, 13.5, 35.5, 89.5, 115.5km

definition: Presence of surface water within a 200 metre radius
The density of terrestrial/aquatic edge within 250 metres calculated using the waterbodies 1:50K spatial layer from the National Hydrology Network
